title: Most U.S. Dairy Cows Come From 2 Bulls. That's Not Good.
description: NPR science correspondent Dan Charles explains why most of the dairy cows in America are descended from just two bulls, creating a lack of genetic diversity that can lead to health problems. He also visits a lab at Penn State University where scientists are trying to change that. Follow reporter/host Emily Kwong on Twitter @emilykwong1234. Email the show at shortwave@npr.org.

itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Why it's a problem that cows are so genetically similar, and what scientists are trying to do about it.
